title: Israel allows fuel delivery into Gaza to restore phone links
description: Israel's war cabinet approved supplying two tankers of fuel daily, responding to Washington's request. On Friday, 17,000 liters of fuel entered Gaza via the Rafah crossing, as confirmed by a Palestinian border official.

title: ChatGPT-maker Open AI fires CEO Sam Altman
description: The San Francisco-based AI company stated in an official announcement on Friday that Altman was 'not consistently candid in his communications'.

title: From a Mexican cartel to the streets of New York: A deep dive into the business of fentanyl
description: For two years, Bertrand Monnet, an expert in the economics of crime, filmed every stage of the Sinaloa cartel's business model in Mexico. In this second episode of Narco Business, Le Monde looks into the cartel's well-oiled organization for selling fentanyl.

title: Senegal's highest court blocks opposition leader Sonko from presidential run
description: Senegal's supreme court overturned a decision that would have reinstated him to Senegal's voter rolls, effectively barring him from running in February 2024 elections.

title: Inuit singer Elisapie's reverse 'cultural appropriation'
description: The singer-songwriter, currently on tour in France, has undertaken to cover hits from the 1970s and 1980s in her mother tongue, Inuktitut. A reappropriation of these words by 'White people' for her own people.

title: White House condemns Musk's 'abhorrent promotion' of anti-Semitism
description: The owner of social media X on Wednesday replied to a post considering that Jewish people encourage 'hatred against whites' saying it was 'the actual truth'.

title: Macron argues against 'punitive' AI regulation
description: The French President, in a nod to the EU's upcoming AI Act, warned against restrictive Artificial Intelligence laws, in order to 'preserve innovation.'

title: 4 takeways from awaited French report on protecting minors from incest and sexual violence
description: The dedicated commission's final report contains 82 recommendations drawn from nearly 30,000 testimonies of victims of abuse as children.

title: A photographer's Whatsapp conversation tells the story of daily life in Gaza
description: WhatsApp messages to fellow photographers from Sameh-Nidal Rahmi, trapped in the besieged Gaza Strip, tell of terror and heartbreak under Israeli bombardment.

title: Author, critic, and poet A.S. Byatt dies aged 87
description: The novelist and short-story writer won the 1990 Booker Prize, as well as many other accolades for her 24 novels and works of criticism. She was made a dame in 1999.

title: Tesla Model 3 adopts new look and features in hopes of boosting demand
description: With 2 million units produced, this car, launched in 2019, has seen its sales decline.

title: Pedro Sanchez's risky gamble
description: The Spanish socialist was reelected as prime minister by MPs, at the cost of an amnesty promised to the organizers of the disputed 2017 independence referendum. With this pact, he risks losing what political credit he has left.

title: French Oscar pick 'The Taste of Things:' An indigestible pot-au-feu
description: Tran Anh Hung's highly academic film about gastronomy and the art of living has been chosen to represent France at the Oscars in March 2024.

title: French senator in custody for allegedly drugging MP with intent to commit rape
description: A woman filed a complaint against Senator Joël Guerriau after she said she felt strange after accepting a drink on Tuesday night at his home.

title: US avoids budget crisis, at the expense of Ukraine and Israel
description: The plan, devised by the new Republican speaker of the House of Representatives, staved off a shutdown, but postpones the passage of aid for Washington's allies until 2024.

title: Why Putin's Russia is holding out
description: On both the Ukrainian front and at home, the Kremlin has enjoyed a string of good news, a point emphasized by the Russian president, who believes that time is on his side.

title: Russian artist sentenced to 7 years in prison over Ukraine supermarket protest
description: Alexandra Skochilenko, 33, replaced last year five price tags a Saint Petersburg supermarket with anti-war messages.

title: Macron acknowledges European splits on Israel-Hamas war
description: Pro-Palestinian protesters demonstrated against the French president's stance on the war in Gaza during his state visit to Switzerland.

title: Azerbaijan rejects Armenia peace talks planned in US
description: The move followed a hearing in the US House Foreign Affairs Committee on Wednesday, where 'biased remarks' were made, according to Azerbaijan.

title: How 'The Crown' has benefited the British royal family's image
description: The sixth and final season of the series, available since November 16 on Netflix, features the Windsors in a far more glamorous and flattering way than the British tabloids.

title: The secrets behind Switzerland's competitiveness
description: The country compensates for its small size and high costs with a high-performing education system, significant investment in R&D and an ecosystem conducive to the emergence of start-ups.

title: European Commission faces criticism for glyphosate reauthorization
description: The lack of agreement among the EU's 27 member states led to the European Commission's decision in favor of the contentious herbicide, leaving individual member states responsible for regulating its usage.

title: What Oedipus and Antigone tell us about the crisis in the Middle East
description: William Marx, the Chair of Comparative Literature at the Collège de France laments the pernicious effects of October 7 on thought and suggests a return to the Greek classics to break away from Manichaeism.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs accused of rape and physical abuse by singer Cassie
description: Casandra Ventura on Thursday filed a lawsuit against the musician and producer, accusing him of rape and over a decade of alleged coercion through physical force and drugs.

title: Pedro Sanchez forges a pact with Catalan independence advocates in Spain
description: The Social president's re-election, secured with Catalan support and amnesty concessions to organizers of the disputed 2017 independence referendum, has stirred intense division within Spain's political landscape.

title: Zelensky claims that artillery shell deliveries to Ukraine decreased since the start of Israel-Hamas war
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told reporters Thursday that shipments of key artillery shells have 'really slowed down' since fighting erupted between Israel and Hamas last month.

title: Erdogan's visit to Germany set amidst heightened tension
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has pushed back against Erdogan's critical comments about Israel ahead of the Turkish president's upcoming visit to Berlin on Friday, his first visit there since 2020.
